name: The St. Regis Bangkok

reviews.text: I hadn't visited Thailand in 10 years, and was stunned to see the continued urbanization of the country.
reviews.title: Exquisite, perfect service, and world-leading luxury...

reviews.text: The new, pristine St Regis is on par with the nicest hotels I've stayed at in Japan, known for it's nicest-in-the-world hotel industry.
reviews.title: Cental location with very nice rooms

reviews.text: Service was perfect, from the multiple room service orders (great food, reasonably priced) to the Thai massage/spa (wonderful and affordable), to the butler/concierge service (which I had assumed would be more of a novelty but was pulled off perfectly at this property).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel but...

reviews.text: The work out room was fantastic, the pool luxurious, the decor through the hotel Asian modern, minimalist, and uber-sophisticated.
reviews.title: St. Regis BKK

reviews.text: Most remarkable of all is that we booked our room for $180/nt. Similar St. Regis properties, with this caliber of service, routinely book for $400-$500+ per night. One has to imagine, as Bangkok continues it's growth as one of the fastest growing economic Asian "tigers", rates will start climbing soon enough.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel ideally located.
Convenient Excellence
reviews.text: Located near intersection of two elevated train lines it is perfectly located to get around busy Bangkok. The hotel is elegant and the service is superb. We were upgraded to a suite and it was very nice. The complimentary buffet breakfast was amazing.

fantastic hotel. great views of the bangkok club (racecourse, and golf course). fantastic sized rooms, superb pool and spa, great breakfast spread. Location is also very good, connected to Ratchadamri BTS (sky train). Super service - very helpful staff. Kids enjoyed immensely as well. Perfect place for both business and pleasure. Couldn't ask for anything better or anything more.
reviews.title: Excellent location, excellent facilities. Super Value for Money for a 5 star property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only wish they had access to more reasonably priced internet access (or better yet, it should be free.)
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Excellent Service, A Must Stay!

reviews.text: This is a long overdue review. When I arrived at St. Regis Bangkok in April 2012, I was delighted to be greeted by beautiful and English speaking hostess. Upon checkin, I really must comment on Mr. Narongsak or I think they call him Bank, really nice guy and speaks good english. Gave us complimentary wifi access just because we had to wait for our room which was a really nice touch. We didnt wait that long of course and then he showed us to our luxurious room. We got a beautiful view of Bangkok city. Thank you so much Bank!
reviews.title: Good for Business Trip, not Perfect for Leisure
Five Star Hotel at Good Rate & Good Location
reviews.text: I really love this hotel because of the staff and its location. The MRT Station is just next to the hotel.You can even walk to shopping complexes near the hotel. The food isn't bad either. The varanda / the open air area at the Lobby is fantastic! And I really liked the waitresses uniforms. They look elegant!

I am a Starwood Platinum Member and this is one the top hotels I have stayed at recently. The service is great and the people who work here seem to be happy to be here... which makes your stay so much better. The breakfast buffet at Viu is great and it has an amazing "Viu" of the Bangkok Sporting Club while you eat. My room was beautiful and well kept. It seems like nothing makes the hotel employees happier than servicing their guests with top notch service. I love the location as you can walk to many great shops and restaurants. I am often in Bangkok and will absolutely make this my hotel of choice going forward. The small negative comment I have of this hotel is that could be more Thai inside... meaning the actual hotel could be in any city or country in the world. I would love to seem them bring in more Thai furnishings or art to make this hotel feel more like you are in Thailand.
reviews.title: Great hotel with an awesome location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was top notch. The rooms were large, with very nice bathrooms, Ipod dock and DVD player. The bar had a nice view of the city and golf course, as our room had a decent view as well. The afternoon tea time was great and a good value. The pool and hot tub area was very modern and really nice. The staff is very friendly, very helpful, and spoke decent English. We loved that this hotel has a direct tunnel to the Sky Train. As small as that is, it is a very nice feature.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Hits
reviews.title: hits and miss

reviews.text: 1) It is located next to the BTS station, with direct skybridge link to the hotel. This is very convenient on a rainy day or for single female travelers (like myself), who may not feel so safe walking alone on the street at night (as this hotel is not located along the busy streets)
reviews.title: Best hotel in Bangkok over all...
A very good new hotel in Bangkok
reviews.text: 2) The concierge staff is very helpful with answering my questions pertaining to Chatuchak market. She even gave me a map and some useful shopping tips

I was here for a night in September of 2012, just after they opened, so I was prepared for the usual "working through the kinks" experience. Everything was absolutely perfect. The hotel is gorgeous, with spacious rooms and bathrooms - mine had a tub and a shower.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel in BKK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used their car service to pick me up from the airport. I was greeted at the gate, walked to immigration, and then met on the other side. The ride was pleasant, and uneventful, with water, chilled towels, and snacks.
reviews.title: just excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was quick, with the butler taking me to my room, providing a quick, but thorough explanation of amenities. I used the hotel dry cleaning services, which were impeccable. The bed was amazing - although, most are after 20 hours in the air! I had breakfast the following morning in the hotel. Both the Eastern and Western breakfasts were phenomenal. Tons of fresh fruit, sushi, soup, pastries, freshly squeezed juices, and traditional American fare, as well.
reviews.title: Just one step away from the excellence
Very Chic
reviews.text: I spent time at the pool, which is beautiful and overlooks the race track. Pool service was adequate. I had a noodle dish for lunch that was great. The spa was pristine, although I did not have a chance to use it.
Overall, my experience here was fabulous. Service was outstanding, yet discreet - as I prefer it. I would highly recommend staying here. Very impressed. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: I would give 6 stars !

description: The magnificent St. Regis Hotel is a paean to timeless elegance, stately situated in Bangkok's most coveted address along Rajadamri Road, the city's key commercial corridor where major corporations and elite financial institutions make their home.
